TopicTitle: Attaching a new light and my Satellite explodes!

Articles.Content:
It seems there was a  minor update and the mk-1 illuminator got some new look. But when I attach one of them on my satellite it EXPLODES! Everytime! I restarted the game just in case but my station keeps exploding!

Edited January 31, 2021 by alphaprior
Anyone? This is clearly a bug.

19 hours ago, alphaprior said:

It seems there was a  minor update and the mk-1 illuminator got some new look. But when I attach one of them on my satellite it EXPLODES! Everytime! I restarted the game just in case but my station keeps exploding!

What does the F3 dialog say when this happens?

And are you running any mods?  If so, is this something you can reproduce in stock?

If you have found a bug... best thing to do is to report it on the official bug-tracker site (I just now checked, and I couldn't find such a bug already reported):

  • https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/

...and once you've done that, could you share a link here for those of us who may be interested to follow along?

Game is modded yes. I keep all mods updated. And most of them if not all are well known no strange or old mods.
I tried to find the flight results log but there is none. So I just type it myself. Note that this might not be limited to spotlight but anything.
I have Bilkin engineer on EVA, I switch to build mode or press i. Once I attach the spotlight station explodes Bilkin dies along with everyone else in the station.

Flight Recorder: Catastrophic Failure!

- Bilkin Kerman from Kerbin Space Station went on EVA.

- C2 High gain antenna HG-5 collided into PPD-8 'Wharf' station core.

and the list goes long with collisions, structural failures and crashes. 

those 2 parts the antenna and ppd-8 are far away from where I'm attaching the light but disaster seems to start at the attach point. Connected parts break apart and quickly the whole station explodes before I can see anything else.

I've looked further into KSP.log and find some more info:

[LOG 16:17:59.359] [FLIGHT GLOBALS]: Switching To Vessel Bilkin Kerman ---------------------- 
[LOG 16:17:59.368] Detected switch from sspx-core-375-1 (Kerbin Space Station) (Vessel) to kerbalEVA (Bilkin Kerman) (Vessel). Request camera stabilization.
[LOG 16:17:59.369] [PlanetariumCamera]: Focus: Bilkin Kerman
[LOG 16:17:59.391] [ApplicationLauncher] SetVisible: 
[LOG 16:17:59.392] ScaleModList: listSize 861 maxListSize 630
[LOG 16:17:59.392] [ApplicationLauncher] SetHidden: 
[LOG 16:17:59.392] ScaleModList: listSize 861 maxListSize 671
[LOG 16:17:59.413] Fix camera focus while keeping its position
[LOG 16:17:59.415] [BetterBurnTime] Vessel changed to Bilkin Kerman
[LOG 16:17:59.538] ScaleModList: listSize 861 maxListSize 671
[LOG 16:17:59.578] 2/1/2021 4:17:59 PM,KerbalAlarmClock,Vessel Change from 'Kerbin Space Station' to 'Bilkin Kerman'
[LOG 16:17:59.582] 2/1/2021 4:17:59 PM,KerbalAlarmClock,Active Vessel changed - resetting inqueue flag
[LOG 16:17:59.610] 2/1/2021 4:17:59 PM,KerbalAlarmClock,Removing DrawGUI from PostRender Queue
[LOG 16:17:59.654] 2/1/2021 4:17:59 PM,KerbalAlarmClock,Adding DrawGUI to PostRender Queue
[LOG 16:17:59.654] 2/1/2021 4:17:59 PM,KerbalAlarmClock,Skipping version check
[LOG 16:18:00.445] [USI-LS] Vessel situation changed, refreshing life support
[LOG 16:18:04.025] Stop KIS behavior due to construct mode
[LOG 16:18:04.029] KIS UI lock released
[LOG 16:18:14.058] [SCANsat] Height Map Of [Mun] Completed...
[LOG 16:18:22.601] Event Weld Started not assigned to state Ladder (Idle)
[LOG 16:18:22.761] [KSPI]: GameEventSubscriber - detected OnPartDestroyed
[ERR 16:18:22.762] Can't remove Rigidbody because ConfigurableJoint, ConfigurableJoint depends on it 

last line repeats many times until:

[LOG 16:18:22.906] Event Construction Mode Exited not assigned to state Ragdoll
[EXC 16:18:22.910] NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
    KerbalEVA.ragdoll_OnEnter (KFSMState st) (at <2afc64dea36946459d4707808bdac511>:0)
    KerbalFSM.RunEvent (KFSMEvent evt) (at <2afc64dea36946459d4707808bdac511>:0)
    KerbalEVA.OnCollisionEnter (UnityEngine.Collision c) (at <2afc64dea36946459d4707808bdac511>:0)
    UnityEngine.DebugLogHandler:LogException(Exception, Object)
    ModuleManager.UnityLogHandle.InterceptLogHandler:LogException(Exception, Object)
    UnityEngine.Debug:CallOverridenDebugHandler(Exception, Object)
[LOG 16:18:22.910] Event Stumble not assigned to state Ragdoll

the rest seem to be destruction and more destruction 
Not sure but the red line seems like an error to me after that the disaster happens.

Edited February 1, 2021 by alphaprior

18 minutes ago, alphaprior said:

I've looked further into KSP.log and find some more info:

Yeah, that kinda sounds like a bug, all right.  Could you log it on their bug tracker, per the above suggestion?  (And post a link here, for those of us who'd like to follow along.)

Unfortunatelly it requires different registration from forum.
So I'll post just into the update announcement.

3 minutes ago, alphaprior said:

Unfortunatelly it requires different registration from forum.
So I'll post just into the update announcement.

Fair 'nuff... but it's quick to register, and if it doesn't get logged into the bug tracker, it's significantly less likely that the team will take a look at it.

You're running KSP 1.11.1, yes?

@Snark Pretty sure I reported this bug. 

https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/27194

Pity there is no video to show the issue, it could technically be a few bugs all at the same time.

 

Edited February 2, 2021 by Anth12
Since this is turning out to be a technical issue, the thread has been moved to modded support.
